51.title: Escape from Terra
51.author: by Sandy Sandfort, Scott Bieser, & Lee Oaks!
notes: Contents previously appeared on the World Wide Web.

"In the late 21st century humans are colonizing the Solar System, finding fabulous wealth and re-discovering freedom in the far-flung Asteroid Belt. But the United World government on Terra envies the Belter's wealth, and is determined to bring these "cowboys" under central control, one way or another."

56.title: Sandhya Raaga
56.author: by A
56.appears_in: N. Krishna avara janapriya kaadambari aadhaarita.
notes: Summary (from English-language version): "This is the story of Lakshmana, a young man who dedicates his life to music. He is the son of Srinivasa Rao, a much respected cultured man of village Hosahalli. While Lakshhmana's brother Ramu chooses to go in for the power and comforts of a secure job Lakshmana treads the difficult path of music. Anakru sketches the trials and tribulations Lakshmana has to undergo before he could earn fame as a versatile singer and win the hearts of connoisseurs of music. Sandhya Raaga is one of the very few books in Kannada that has music as the theme. The novel highlights the greatness of Indian classical music, the relationship between the master and the disciple, family ties and the values of rural life. Sandhya Raaga is one of the most popular novels of Anakru and has been made into a film."

57.title: Sandhya Raaga : based on a popular Kannada novel
57.author: by Anakru ; art, Gujjarappa ; script, R
57.appears_in: C. Haralapura ; English version, Dr. M. V. Rajeshwari.
notes: "This is the story of Lakshmana, a young man who dedicates his life to music. He is the son of Srinivasa Rao, a much respected cultured man of village Hosahalli. While Lakshhmana's brother Ramu chooses to go in for the power and comforts of a secure job Lakshmana treads the difficult path of music. Anakru sketches the trials and tribulations Lakshmana has to undergo before he could earn fame as a versatile singer and win the hearts of connoisseurs of music. Sandhya Raaga is one of the very few books in Kannada that has music as the theme. The novel highlights the greatness of Indian classical music, the relationship between the master and the disciple, family ties and the values of rural life. Sandhya Raaga is one of the most popular novels of Anakru and has been made into a film."

60.heading: Sandifer, Philip.
60.title: A Golden Thread : an Unofficial Critical History of Wonder Woman
60.author: Philip Sandifer.
notes: "For over seventy years Wonder Woman has been one of the most popular and recognized comic book characters in the world. Now, for the first time, A Golden Thread presents a detailed critical history of the character. From her origins as a World War II-era avatar of William Moulton Marston's vision of a feminist bondage utopia to the present day, this book looks closely at seven decades of Wonder Woman comics alongside her appearances in television and film. Through her many highs and many lows, this book traces the unlikely story of the world's most popular feminist character."

85.heading: Sandjarrs.
85.title: Ruptures
85.author: drawing, Serge Pellé ; script, Sylvain Runberg ; translator, Jerome Saincantin.
notes: Translated from the French: Orbital 2: Ruptures.

"Caleb (a human) and Mezoke (a Sandjarr) are paired up as special agents to keep the intergalactic peace. This is a controversial and historic alliance given their races' longstanding enmity, and a lot of people are watching. Their first mission is to keep war from breaking out between humans and Javlodes on the planet Senestam. Caleb acts as a mediator between the warring factions while dealing with an attack by highly destructive insects called Stilvulls
and he also has to contend with his feelings for charming doctor Kim Vandersel. Meanwhile, Mezoke is on the planet Upssal, trying to appease the Javlodes."

contents.title: World's end

notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as The Sandman 51-56"
Summary (from OCLC): Stephen King's Introduction sets the stage for a series of tales with a haunting geometry

some angular, some parallel, some concentric. An eerie mirror of Chaucer's Canterbury Tales, this collection tells of a group of travelers from throughout time, myth and dream, who converge at a mysterious inn to seek refuge from a "reality storm". Mature readers.

184.heading: The Sandman.
184.title: Delirium's Party : a Little Endless Storybook
184.author: by Jill Thompson.
notes: A children's book based on characters created by Neil Gaiman, et al. for The Sandman comic book series.

Summary (form OCLC): This Little Endless picture book features the popular Endless characters (Destiny, Death, Dream, Destruction, Despair, Desire, and Delirium) from Neil Gaiman's The Sandman comic book rendered in "diminuitive form". In Delirium's Party, when Delirium notices her sister, Despair, never smiles, she throws a party for her and all of their siblings bring gifts to cheer her up.

186.appears_in: Seagle, writers ; Guy Davis, artist ; David Hornung, colorist ; John Costanza, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Sandman Mystery Theatre 37-44."

Summary (from publisher via SkyRiver): "The crime-filled, noir world of the '30s continues! Collecting issues #37-44 of the acclaimed series as the Golden Age Sandman discovers the origin of one of his oldest adversaries and unravels the mystery of a series of brutal murders amid the 1939 New York World's Fair."
